qas.question: How is Catalan different from other Romance languages?
What other type of endings do Catalan words have?
What kind of final devoicing does the language have?

context: In contrast with other Romance languages, Catalan has <a0_0>many monosyllabic words<a0_0/>; and those ending in a wide variety of consonants and some <a1_0>consonant clusters<a1_0/>. Also, Catalan has final <a2_0>obstruent<a2_0/> devoicing, thus featuring many <a3_0>couplets<a3_0/> like amic "(male friend") vs. amiga ("female friend").
